name: Meridian Port Douglas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely with all the necessary amenities for a very comfortable stay and then some ... We enjoyed a superior double room with direct access to the pool and our own private deck with loungers as well as jacuzzi. The room was beautifully and tastefully decorated and the kitchen had all the necessary equipment to stay and eat in if we chose. The close proximity to both beach and centre with shops and restaurants made it an absolutely perfect location to finish off a month of relentless touring of Australia. John and Sue's warm and hospitable welcome made it all perfect. Thank you !
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Place is very clean and staff very helpful. However it is not particularly private if you want somewhere special for your honeymoon. We booked the deluxe honeymoon suite and were so disappointed. The door to our room was about 4 steps from reception and we could hear every voice quite clearly and I assume, vice versa. Bathroom was so tiny only one person could stand comfortably. Our room was situated on the ground floor and situated right in front of the main pool area. Everyone could see directly into our room. There were only heavy wooden shutters so if we wanted privacy and we closed them, it felt like we were in a cave. There were no wire screens on the doors so had to keep them closed too and use air-conditioning as there were mosquitoes. Could not get air-con temperature right so we were either freezing cold or being bitten by insects. .We only stayed three days but it really spoilt the last days of our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Not for Honeymooners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip Advisor has done it again! The Meridian is all it is cracked up to be and more. Got to love this site!
reviews.title: All it is cracked up to be

reviews.text: From form the moment we walked in the door, everything was perfect, the warm wlecome, the bottle of something cold in the fridge, the service & the smiles.
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My better half was well pleased with the apartment, faultlessly clean & an attractive outlook right out over the heated pool. Location was terrific with a pleasant stroll down to the beach in the evenings, if you enjoy fine dining, "Port" as it;'s known to the locals is pretty hard to beat, try an evening out on the deck at the "Tin Shed", cheap & cheerful & with the best outlook in town. We had a fantastic time at the Meridian, John and Sue really know their medicine when it comes to service & went out of their way to make our special weekend away from the kids something special, give it a go, you won;t be dissapointed!
reviews.title: Good Location, Very Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Meridian for four nights in mid-May 2009, the beginning of the dry season. We recommend it.
reviews.title: A perfect honeymoon retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Meridian is one of the many newer properties in Port Douglas. It is a smaller and more intimate hotel, so if you want spa treatments, room service, and tennis courts you should look elsewhere. Also, it is not a service hotel, so the room won’t be cleaned unless you stay longer than we did. The Meridian is well located, just a block from Macrosan, the main street with most of the shops and restaurants. It is an attractive three story building with lush landscaping around the outside and the pool courtyard.
reviews.title: Overrated and Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (18B) was a corner room on the second floor and had three small balconies facing the main street and a side street. Surprisingly, though, there was no furniture on the balconies and nothing in the room could easily be moved onto them. The room was fairly large and attractively furnished with a queen bed, table and two chairs, tv stand, and two night stands. There was also a small kitchenette area with sink, microwave, and small refrigerator, and cabinet with dishes. There were two closets for clothes though the drawer space was only marginally adequate. The large attractively tiled bathroom had a shower/jacuzi tub combination, and a vanity with a fashionable bowel sink and adequate counter space for toiletries. The a.c. unit was quiet and effective.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Meridian was a nice way to end 12 months of planning a wedding. We took some relatives from overseas to Port Douglas who stayed at nearby 'The Verandah' while we opted to stay at The Meridian. Compared to some of the other accomodation we had seen in Port Douglas (in person), The Meridian was probably one of the easiest to get around, especially if you had a ground floor swim out suite, like us. Others seemed to have a lot of stairs, some without elevators, so this would be a great stay for those with disabilities.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
Not what we were expecting --- sadly disappointed
reviews.text: The Meridian was so peaceful, and with a 24 hour pool (with note to be considerate about noise after 7pm) was a big plus. Our balcony allowed for us to slip into the pool for an evening dip under the stars. I disagree with the previous comment that the pool was small, whilst not huge, it was definately big enough.

reviews.title: Great Facilities & Ideal Location
reviews.text: We loved the firm beds, and the ample bathroom space, facilities were new and comfortable but the best part of our stay was the staff and owners of The Meridian, we managed to book our tours directly through them and received a group discount too. They were so friendly and obviously very knowledgable about the area, gave great advice. The hotel was situated just around the corner from main Macrossan Street, and close to the Marina. You do need to pay extra for internet access. Ample soft towels provided as well as laundry facilities. Very convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we loved our stay at The Meridian. We will definately be back for more.
reviews.title: A week of peace, comfort and relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were disappointed with the Meridian. We were hoping for a luxury hotel with lots of space, peace and quiet to relax and escape our normal city life. The photos online are misleading and make the hotel & pool appear a lot larger and more spacious than it really is. The hotel is built right on the side of the road, on a very busy street corner with noisy tour buses and traffic heading to the marina & into town all hours of the day & night. The rooms are tiny and they are apartment style which means you don't have your room cleaned daily ---no new towels, bed doesn't get made, and the dishes pile up unless you wash them yourself --- not my idea of a vacation. Also we found the bed and pillows to be uncomfortable and hard.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely! Our room was medium sized,well appointed, the staff was friendly and attentive, and the location was perfect. It is a short walk to town but far enough away, that it is very quiet and peaceful and the beach is almost across the street. We had a hot tub, but unfortunately, never got a chance to use it. I would recommend getting a room with pool access, because these rooms have their own sunbathing chairs and steps into the pool. We hope to come back soon!
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful rooms, fantastic pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the Meridian where the staff provided excellent service and we believe we received great value for our money.
reviews.title: Classy, convenient with 5 star service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was very quiet and convenient as it is only a short walk to the main restaurants and shopping areas.
reviews.title: Awesome Staff - Hotel Just Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend booking your tours at the resort when you first arrive, as we were able to change the date of the tour due to bad weather conditions, which was done without any hassle.
reviews.title: Unforgettable Romance

reviews.title: Great Place for Great Time
